summary: This is a transcript of the deposition of Bernard Hugh Tovar, a CIA employee, before the House Select Committee on Assassinations on June 29, 1978, regarding CIA policies on debriefing returning American defectors and the Agency's interest in Lee Harvey Oswald's return from the Soviet Union.
summary_one_paragraph: On June 29, 1978, Bernard Hugh Tovar, a CIA employee, provided a deposition to the House Select Committee on Assassinations, represented by Michael Goldsmith, concerning the CIA's practices regarding the debriefing of American defectors returning from the Soviet Union, the role of the CI Staff, and the Agency's interest in Lee Harvey Oswald upon his return in 1962; Tovar discussed the lack of a standard procedure for debriefing defectors, the division of responsibilities between the CIA and FBI, and the CIA's potential interest in Oswald for counterintelligence or positive intelligence purposes, focusing on whether Oswald was considered a counterintelligence threat or possessed information of value to the Agency.
title: Deposition of Bernard Hugh Tovar
